tn.ref: The lowest story ... the middle ... the third
tn.text: This refers to the rooms in each story of the building.

tn.ref: five cubits ... six cubits ... seven cubits
tn.text: A cubit is 46 centimeters. AT: "about 2.3 meters ... about 2.8 meters ... about 3.2 meters" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])

tn.ref: he made offsets in the wall of the house
tn.text: They made ledges all around the main building to support the beams of the small rooms.
A beam is a long heavy piece of wood used to support a building.
Here "house" refers to God's house, the temple.
A quarry is where people cut large stones from a mountain and shape them with tools so they are smooth. After they prepared the stones at the quarry, they brought them to the temple.

tn.ref: ground level ... middle level ... third level
tn.text: There were a total of three floors. Some languages call these "ground floor," "first floor," and "second floor."

tn.ref: Solomon built the temple and finished it
tn.text: It might be best to translate so that the reader understands that other people helped Solomon do this. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
A beam is a long heavy piece of wood used to support a building. Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:1ki:06:05|6:6]].
A plank is a flat wooden board used for floors and walls.
These are the same rooms that are referred to in [[:en:bible:notes:1ki:06:05|6:5]].
This phrase is a metonym for the walls that enclosed the chambers. AT: "exterior walls that enclosed the inner chambers" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
A cubit is 46 centimeters. AT: "2.3 meters" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])
The word "timbers" is a general term that refers to wood used for building, such as beams and planks.

This is an idiom that is used to introduce something that God told his prophets or his people. AT: "Yahweh spoke this message" or "Yahweh spoke these words" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
The word "walk" is a metaphor for "live" or "obey." AT: "continually obey all my statutes" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Possible meanings are 1) "carry out all of my laws" or 2) "treat the people whom you are ruling justly."

tn.ref: keep all my commandments and walk in them
tn.text: These two phrases mean basically the same thing and emphasize the importance of obeying God's commandments. AT "carefully obey all I tell you to do" (See [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: I will confirm my promise with you that I had made to David your father
tn.text: "I will do everything I promised David your father that I would do for you"
